conclusion: Analyze displacement x as a function of time t from the graph.
The graph shows a particle moving in a straight line, with its position x decreasing over time t.
The speed of the particle can be calculated from the graph by finding the slope of the line at any given time t.
At t = 2 seconds, the particle's position is 10 m.
At t = 4 seconds, the particle's position is -10 m.
The slope of the line at t = 2 seconds is the speed of the particle.
The slope of the line at t = 2 seconds is 5 m/s.
The slope of the line at t = 4 seconds is the speed of the particle.
The slope of the line at t = 4 seconds is -2.5 m/s.
The particle's speed is 5 m/s at t = 2 seconds.
The particle's speed is 5 m/s at t = 4 seconds.
There are 2 moments when the speed of the particle is 5 m/s within the time interval from 0 to 4 seconds.
